snippet: Swiss measures are the newest and most far-reaching of the say-on-pay policies now in place or under consideration in many European nations.
abstract: Editorial applauds Swiss voters for overwhelmingly approving referendum to give shareholders binding say on executive pay, to date most far-reaching of various say-on-pay policies in  European nations; criticizes fact that weaker American shareholder protections are not enforced, and that Republicans in Senate have been attempting to weaken such protections even further.
lead_paragraph: Swiss measures are the newest and most far-reaching of the say-on-pay policies now in place or under consideration in many European nations.

headline.seo: Shareholders in Europe Demand Control on Executive Pay

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
